body:
<!--
**PLEASE READ THIS FIRST:**
- Do not use the bug and feature tracker for support requests. Use the `cython-users` mailing list instead.
- Did you search for similar issues already? Please do, it helps to save us precious time that we otherwise could not invest into development.
- Did you try the latest master branch or pre-release? It might already have what you want to report. Also see the [Changelog](https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/CHANGES.rst) regarding recent changes.
-->

**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

latest commit running python 3.11a5 crashes sometimes with NoneTyoe has no attribute is_pyobject

**To Reproduce**
Code to reproduce the behaviour:
```cython
```

example: try compiling pydantic with Cython from master branch 


**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

The code doesnâ€™t give a compilererror 

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. Linux, Windows, macOS]
 - Python version [e.g. 3.8.4]
 - Cython version [e.g. 0.29.18]

linux, python 3.11a5, last main commit of cython


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

comment_data.body:
Is that a new issue with Py3.11a5 or does it also occur with a4?
Is it only with Cython master or also with the last 3.0 release?
Oh, and could you provide the stack trace of the crash, please?
I'd also be interested to know if you get the error when Cython isn't compiled? (It's the difference between "CPython has changed something subtle", or "error in Cython")

It looks like Python 3.11a5 is a red-herring. It also fails with Python 3.10 (and I assume other versions too). This is using a non-compiled version of the current master branch

```
[ 4/25] Cythonizing pydantic/class_validators.py

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
) -> Callable[[AnyCallable], 'AnyClassMethod']:
    ...


def root_validator(
    _func: Optional[AnyCallable] = None, *, pre: bool = False, allow_reuse: bool = False, skip_on_failure: bool = False
                  ^
------------------------------------------------------------

pydantic/class_validators.py:115:19: Compiler crash in AnalyseDeclarationsTransform

File 'ModuleNode.py', line 187, in analyse_declarations: ModuleNode(class_validators.py:1:0,
    full_module_name = 'pydantic.class_validators')
File 'Nodes.py', line 392, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(class_validators.py:1:0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 392, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(class_validators.py:114:0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 3083, in analyse_declarations: DefNode(class_validators.py:114:0,
    doc = '\n    Decorate methods on a model indicating that they should be used to validate (and perhaps modify) data either\n    before or after standard model parsing/validation is performed.\n    ',
    modifiers = [...]/0,
    name = 'root_validator',
    needs_closure = True,
    num_kwonly_args = 3,
    outer_attrs = [...]/2,
    py_wrapper_required = True,
    reqd_kw_flags_cname = '0')
File 'Nodes.py', line 3134, in analyse_argument_types: DefNode(class_validators.py:114:0,
    doc = '\n    Decorate methods on a model indicating that they should be used to validate (and perhaps modify) data either\n    before or after standard model parsing/validation is performed.\n    ',
    modifiers = [...]/0,
    name = 'root_validator',
    needs_closure = True,
    num_kwonly_args = 3,
    outer_attrs = [...]/2,
    py_wrapper_required = True,
    reqd_kw_flags_cname = '0')
File 'Nodes.py', line 1819, in align_argument_type: DefNode(class_validators.py:114:0,
    doc = '\n    Decorate methods on a model indicating that they should be used to validate (and perhaps modify) data either\n    before or after standard model parsing/validation is performed.\n    ',
    modifiers = [...]/0,
    name = 'root_validator',
    needs_closure = True,
    num_kwonly_args = 3,
    outer_attrs = [...]/2,
    py_wrapper_required = True,
    reqd_kw_flags_cname = '0')
File 'Nodes.py', line 965, in inject_type_from_annotations: CArgDeclNode(class_validators.py:115:4,
    is_generic = 1,
    name = '_func',
    name_cstring = '"_func"',
    outer_attrs = [...]/2)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 14036, in analyse_type_annotation: AnnotationNode(class_validators.py:115:11,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'ExprNodes.py', line 3685, in analyse_as_type: IndexNode(class_validators.py:115:19,
    is_subscript = True,
    result_is_used = True,
    use_managed_ref = True)
File 'Nodes.py', line 1230, in analyse: TemplatedTypeNode(class_validators.py:115:19)

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "<home_dir>/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython-3.0.0a10-py3.10.egg/Cython/Compiler/Nodes.py", line 1230, in analyse
    self.type = base_type.specialize_here(self.pos, env, template_types)
  File "<home_dir>/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython-3.0.0a10-py3.10.egg/Cython/Compiler/PyrexTypes.py", line 4490, in specialize_here
    not new_type.is_pyobject):
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'is_pyobject'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<home_dir>/Documents/programming/pydantic/setup.py", line 88, in <module>
    ext_modules = cythonize(
  File "<home_dir>/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython-3.0.0a10-py3.10.egg/Cython/Build/Dependencies.py", line 1144, in cythonize
    cythonize_one(*args)
  File "<home_dir>/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython-3.0.0a10-py3.10.egg/Cython/Build/Dependencies.py", line 1311, in cythonize_one
    raise CompileError(None, pyx_file)
Cython.Compiler.Errors.CompileError: pydantic/class_validators.py
```

I think this looks related to interpreting `typing.Optional`. It doesn't look to be an issue with Cython 3.0.0a10

It's fairly likely it'll be fixed with https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/4606 so I don't think it's worth investigating until that is merged.

rename.to: [BUG] Crash when translating Cython code in CPython 3.11a5

title: [BUG] Crash when translating Cython code in CPython 3.11a5
